channel.title: Why are topics always locked when there's a debate?
channel.description:
I can understand locking topics when people are spamming dumb shit and acting a bit childish, and the same goes for deleting posts. But why do staff so often do this for posts that discuss issues that they don't agree with? I mean seriously, you're not running a regime here, it's just a forum.
Does it really matter if someone says something negative about how things are run? As long as the post isn't personally insulting, then they're entitled to their opinion and others are entitled to read it. If the post is wrong then make a reply so that others can see why it was wrong. Deleting a post, locking a topic or muting someone just indicates that you know they may raise a legitimate point that you don't want others agreeing with. Or am I missing something here - do you have very strict bandwidth concerns? Does it improve your link juice if everything is kept to non-meta discussion? Is there so much activity on this forum that we, as readers, simply cannot handle?
Latest example is this topic: http://www.moparcraft.net/smf/index.php/topic,549624.0.html Why was he muted and not allowed to explain himself publicly? Why was his first topic deleted? What does muting someone on the forums achieve when they misbehaved in-game? This pisses me off because the same happened to me when I got banned in-game, and could only watch Davidi construct his lies. By the time my mute expired I didn't have enough shits left to explain what actually happened.
Cue the smart one-word replies, and if I'm lucky, a cleared out & locked thread with a smart answer from mitb.
